name: biomni-query-iucn
title: Biomni: Query Iucn
description: Query the IUCN Red List for species conservation status, population trends, and threat assessments worldwide.
content:
Overview

Searches the IUCN Red List, the comprehensive global database of species conservation status covering over 150,000 species with detailed assessments of extinction risk, population trends, habitat requirements, and conservation actions.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about species conservation
  • endpoint (string, optional): Specific IUCN API endpoint
  • token (string, optional): API access token for authentication
  • verbose (boolean, optional): Enable detailed logging output

Input Format

Create a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "prompt": "Find endangered species in Amazon",
  "endpoint": "/species",
  "token": "your-api-token"
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for conservation biology, biodiversity assessments, and policy-making. Researchers use IUCN data to prioritize conservation efforts, identify species at risk, track population declines, assess habitat loss impacts, inform protected area design, and guide species recovery programs.

Output

Returns a JSON file (iucn_results.json) containing species information including conservation status categories (CR, EN, VU, NT, LC), population trends, geographic range, habitat types, major threats, conservation measures, and assessment history.
